meanings.sent1: The group of dorks in the library were always laughing loudly.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a dork when she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent3: The dork at the party kept telling bad jokes that no one laughed at.
meanings.sent4: He stood out like a dork in a suit at the beach party.
meanings.sent5: The image of a dork with oversized glasses and a pocket protector is hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To behave in a silly or stupid way
meanings.sent1: Stop dorking around and focus on your work.
meanings.sent2: They dorked up the presentation by forgetting the main points.
meanings.sent3: The kids dorked around in the park, playing tag and laughing.
meanings.sent4: She dorked her way through the dance routine, forgetting the steps.
meanings.sent5: The comedian dorked on stage, making funny faces and silly noises.
